alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 2:16PM AKDT until May 28 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Moose Creek at Northway * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occuring in low-lying areas along Moose Creek. High water is impacting portions of the Northway runway and surrounding several homes on the Northway Road between the airport and the Chisana River bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM AKDT, A record winter snowpack in the area has melted and the runoff is moving down Moose Creek. Water levels on Moose Creek are expected to fall later this week as water moves downriver and into the Chisana River. - A long time river observer in Northway reports that this is the highest water seen in 40 years on Moose Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
